page.title: 05 St. Crispin Hospital,Duston
page.content: The original Building, now 105 years old,was built in 200 acres of parkland. It was originally known as the County Lunatic Asylum' when the average stay was a whole lifetime compared with the six months of today. Many parts have since been added & it is planned to demolish the first building,now out- dated & unsuitable for modern treatment There are 425 patients divided into 25 wards with an average of 24 beds per ward. The patients are admitted by a Consultant Psychiatrist. If they are over 65 & senile they go into a mixed Mentally and Infirm Unit'. Others go into one of the three admission wards. If a cure is not effected after six months, the patients are either referred to Outpatients or sent to a Rehabilitation Centre.
